quotes.quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
It is as absurd to argue men, as to torture them, into believing.
It is as absurd to say that a man can't love one woman all the time as it is to say that a violinist needs several violins to play the same piece of music.
Most of the basic truths of life sound absurd at first hearing.
The fact that an opinion has been widely held is no evidence whatever that it is not utterly absurd.
In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
Secretly we're all a little more absurd than we make ourselves out to be.
Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
The absurd depends as much on man as on the world. For the moment, it is all that links them together.
Maturity is often more absurd than youth and very frequently is most unjust to youth.
Only man can be absurd: for only man can be dignified.
It is absurd to say that the age of miracles is past. It has not yet begun.
How absurd human beings are and how magnificent.
The world in which we were called to exist was an absurd world, and there was no other in which we could take refuge.

The absurd is a shadow cast over everything we do and even if we try to live life as if it has meaning as if there are reasons for doing things the absurd will linger in the back of our minds as a nagging doubt that perhaps there is no point.
Life is tragic and absurd, and none of it has any purpose at all.
It is absurd to look for perfection.
The idea that motherhood is inherently somehow a threat to creativity is just absurd.
It is human nature to think wisely and act in an absurd fashion.
There is nothing so absurd that it cannot be believed as truth if repeated often enough.
Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
The origin of the absurd idea of immortal life is easy to discover; it is kept alive by hope and fear, by childish faith, and by cowardice.
The logic of the heart is absurd.
The realization that life is absurd cannot be an end, but only a beginning.
There's nothing so absurd that if you repeat it often enough, people will believe it.
